attributes.comment:
I am a U.S. citizen and am writing to indicate my severe disappointment with the
government's proposed immigration fee hike. My daily efforts largely involve
helping poor immigrant families with their immigration problems, and I assist
hundreds every year. Often, I am not paid for the assistance I render. Those
impacted the most by the fees proposed by Homeland Security will be the
poorest. To highlight one class, nearly every battered spouse that I've ever
assisted has been the victim of despicable violence and is typically barely able to
make ends meet. Ironically, they are usually the ones left to raise the children
without the help of the abuser. Nevertheless, the proposal offered by the
government reasons that a 95% increase in fees on this particular class of people
is warranted.

In my experience, most families would prefer a delay in processing rather than
pay such exorbitant amounts of money, which is literally 'hard-earned'. This
proposed increase is excessive and I strongly urge Congress not to accept it.

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Richard B. Bracken
